identificationModule.briefTitle: Radiofrequency-based Speckle Tracking Echocardiography to Evaluate Diastolic Function
identificationModule.officialTitle: Radiofrequency-based Speckle Tracking Echocardiography to Evaluate Diastolic Function

collaborators.name: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate a novel ultrasound system's ability to assess the relaxing properties of the heart compared to current techniques.

armGroups.label: Single arm study.
interventionNames: Device: Echocardiography system Ultra DCI Model 5000
Device: Echocardiography machine GE Vivid E9

interventions.name: Echocardiography system Ultra DCI Model 5000
interventions.description: Each subject will undergo scanning using the investigational echocardiography system (Ultra DCI Model 5000)to measure Diastolic Circumferential Strain Rate during Isovolumic Relaxation (DCSR-IVR) as novel measure of diastolic function.

interventions.name: Echocardiography machine GE Vivid E9
interventions.description: Each subject will undergo echocardiography using a conventional echocardiography machine to evaluate the early diastolic mitral annular velocity (E-prime) using tissue Doppler as a standard measure of diastolic function.

interventions.name: Diastolic function assessment
interventions.description: Each subject will undergo standard echocardiographic measure of the mitral inflow pattern and invasive catheter-derived measure of left ventricular end-diastolic pressure to determine their diastolic function. This evaluation will be used as the gold standard for this study.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Diastolic Circumferential Strain Rate During Isovolumic Relaxation
primaryOutcomes.description: Diastolic circumferential strain rate during isovolumic relaxation is a novel measure of diastolic function that measures the rate of relaxation of the left ventricle during the interval of isovolumic relaxation (the period of active relaxation). We would expect that a higher value reflects better relaxation, and better diastolic function.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Assessed from echo obtained at time of enrollment

primaryOutcomes.measure: Early Diastolic Mitral Annular Velocity (E-prime) Using Tissue Doppler
primaryOutcomes.description: E-prime is a conventional commonly-used parameter of diastolic function. Higher values of E-prime typically reflect better diastolic function.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Assessed from echo obtained at time of enrollment

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patients scheduled to undergo a clinically indicated left heart cardiac catheterization will be recruited for the study.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Suspected acute ST elevation myocardial infarction.
* Acute coronary syndrome with active ongoing chest pain
* Known or suspected acute aortic dissection
* Known or suspected cardiac tamponade
* Known history of unoperated constrictive pericarditis
* Known or suspected severe aortic stenosis or severe mitral regurgitation
* Heart rhythm other than sinus rhythm on pre-cath EKG
* Age \< 18 years old
* Unable to provide informed consent

groups.title: All Study Participants
groups.description: All study participants underwent measurement of Diastolic Circumferential Strain Rate during Isovolumic Relaxation as well as measurement of E-prime by tissue Doppler. They also all had evaluation of their diastolic function by the combination of their mitral inflow pattern and invasive measure of left ventricular end-diastolic pressure.

outcomeMeasures.title: Diastolic Circumferential Strain Rate During Isovolumic Relaxation
outcomeMeasures.description: Diastolic circumferential strain rate during isovolumic relaxation is a novel measure of diastolic function that measures the rate of relaxation of the left ventricle during the interval of isovolumic relaxation (the period of active relaxation). We would expect that a higher value reflects better relaxation, and better diastolic function.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Only 26 subjects had adequate images for assessment of DCSR-IVR and had gold standard assessment of diastolic function, and the analysis was limited to these subjects.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Assessed from echo obtained at time of enrollment

groups.title: Normal Diastolic Function
groups.description: These were the subjects deemed to have normal diastolic function using the gold standard assessment of mitral inflow and LV end-diastolic pressure (E/A 1 - 2 and LVEDP \<= 15 mm Hg).

groups.title: Grade 1 Diastolic Dysfunction
groups.description: These were the subjects deemed to have Grade 1 diastolic dysfunction using the gold standard assessment of mitral inflow and LV end-diastolic pressure (E/A \< 1.0).

groups.title: Grade 2 Diastolic Dysfunction
groups.description: These were the subjects deemed to have Grade 2 diastolic dysfunction using the gold standard assessment of mitral inflow and LV end-diastolic pressure (E/A 1 - 2 and LVEDP \> 15 mm Hg).

outcomeMeasures.title: Early Diastolic Mitral Annular Velocity (E-prime) Using Tissue Doppler
outcomeMeasures.description: E-prime is a conventional commonly-used parameter of diastolic function. Higher values of E-prime typically reflect better diastolic function.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Only 25 subjects had adequate images for assessment of DCSR-IVR and interpretable tissue Doppler and gold standard assessment of diastolic function, and the analysis was limited to these subjects.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Assessed from echo obtained at time of enrollment

groups.title: Normal Diastolic Function
groups.description: These were the subjects deemed to have normal diastolic function using the gold standard assessment of mitral inflow and LV end-diastolic pressure (E/A 1 - 2 and LVEDP \<= 15 mm Hg).

groups.title: Grade 1 Diastolic Dysfunction
groups.description: These were the subjects deemed to have Grade 1 diastolic dysfunction using the gold standard assessment of mitral inflow and LV end-diastolic pressure (E/A \< 1.0).

groups.title: Grade 2 Diastolic Dysfunction
groups.description: These were the subjects deemed to have Grade 2 diastolic dysfunction using the gold standard assessment of mitral inflow and LV end-diastolic pressure (E/A 1 - 2 and LVEDP \> 15 mm Hg).
